action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a shelf, a chair, a book and a couch. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book.
You can't see a pillow here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a bed and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow and a book.
You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a shelf, a chair and a couch. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a shelf, a chair and a couch. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.

You can't see a plate here.

You can't see a plate here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
